result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R. Brey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park
Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for any prescriptions taken in prescribed dosages.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Comply with any other counseling as directed; 

Comply with all policies and procedures to complete Manitowoc County Drug Court;

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law, imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the discretion of the agent and upon order of the court on count 3 only.

records.addlTxt:
2:59 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua R. Brey appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz appeared by video for Joshua R. Brey. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on May 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on April 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:43 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua R. Brey appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Sara Elizabeth Stertz appeared by video for Joshua R. Brey. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Sara Stertz, through Public Defender.
Initial appearance on February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Prints to MTPD.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for initial appearance on 2-21-2022 at 1:30pm in Br. 2.  Bail is set at $1,000 cash bond with no other conditions. Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.  Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon. 
Minutes.
Warrant served.
Re:  Deliver Fentanyl, second & subsequent offense within 1,000 feet of park, on 10-13-21.
